courses.title: Human Factors for Offshore Drilling Operations Masterclass
courses.description: An advanced course applying Human Factors principles specifically to offshore drilling and marine operations. Built from IADC North Sea Chapter guidance and UK regulatory requirements, covering HF integration in MODU design, control room environments, barrier management, offshore work organization, and safety case compliance.
learningObjectives: Apply HF integration principles throughout MODU design and modification projects
Evaluate control room design against ISO 11064 and EEMUA standards
Conduct Human Reliability Analysis for safety-critical drilling tasks
Identify and optimize Performance Influencing Factors
Apply bowtie analysis to understand human contributions to MAH control
Implement Fatigue Risk Management Plans for offshore operations
Assess staffing adequacy using recognized methodologies (CRIOP)
Design and implement effective alarm management systems
Develop procedural integrity linked to MAH scenarios
Prepare HF content for UK safety case submissions
Conduct accident investigations identifying latent organizational factors
Manage organizational change with HF impact assessment
